Interactive Poster Session for RSS Pioneers


Monday, July 12

0d 00h 00m



 
AEST BJT CEST Eastern Pacific
UTC+10 UTC+8 UTC+2 UTC-4 UTC-7
Start: 12:15AM 10:15PM 04:15PM 10:15AM 07:15AM
Finish: 01:15AM 11:15PM 05:15PM 11:15AM 08:15AM
 


The 2021 cohort of RSS pioneers

This poster session will highlight the work of soon to be famous roboticists. The RSS Pioneers event will run through the 11th.

ID Title Authors
01  Inductive Biases for Learning in Robotics and Control Michael Lutter
02  Towards Ubiquitous Haptics for Embodied AI Agents Jose Barreiros
03  Fostering Human-Robot Cohesion in Multi-Party Settings Filipa Correia, Francisco S. Melo, and Ana Paiva
04  Distributed and Safe Autonomy in Unknown and Communication-Denied Environments Yiannis Kantaros
05  Social Robots that Understand Natural Language Instructions and Resolve Ambiguities Fethiye Irmak Doğan
06  Multimodal Representation Learning for Robot Perception and Agency Miguel Vasco, Francisco S. Melo, and Ana Paiva
07  Certifiable Outlier-Robust Machine Perception Heng Yang
08  Learning Deep Observation Models for Factor Graph Inference Paloma Sodhi
09  Towards Terrain-Aware Autonomous Exploration in 3D Confined Spaces Héctor Azpúrua
10  Bio-Inspired Robot Perception Coupled with Robot-Modeled Human Perception Tobias Fischer
11  Uncertainty Estimation for Lifelong Robot Perception Systems Ali Harakeh
12  Towards Predictive and Proactive Monitoring and Planning for Safe Autonomous Robotic Operations Esen Yel
13  Interactive Reinforcement Learning from Imperfect Teachers Taylor A. Kessler Faulkner and Andrea Thomaz
14  Honey, I Shrunk the Robot: Designing Miniature Surgical Robots Yash Chitalia
15  Toward Practical Collaborative Manipulation Preston Culbertson
16  Limb Mechanics for Performance Justin Yim
17  Towards Continuous Learned Semantic Representation through a Viewpoint-Dependent Observation Model Yuri Feldman and Vadim Indelman
18  Leveraging Human Input for Robust Robot Learning Daniel S. Brown
19  Discovering and Segmenting Unseen Objects for Robot Perception Christopher Xie
20  Tactile Object Pose Estimation from the First Touch Maria Bauza Villalonga
21  Situational Awareness and Long-Term Autonomy for Robot Swarms Vivek Shankar Varadharajan
22  Active Perception for Aerial and Ground Robot Teams Operating in Unknown Enivronments Micah Corah
23  Structured and Distributed Approaches for Robot Perception and Control Alexander "Sasha" Lambert
24  Towards Safe and Resilient Autonomy in Multi-Robot Systems Wenhao Luo
25  Moving Object Segmentation for LiDAR-Based Localization and Mapping Xieyuanli Chen
26  Robotic (Collaborative) Manipulation: Is it "just" a Matter of Interfaces? Maria Pozzi
27  Variable Stiffness Soft Growing Robots as Manipulators Brian H. Do
28  Model-Based Control and Design of Soft Robots James M. Bern
29  Learning State-Dependent Measurement Likelihood Models with Limited Sensor Data Troi Williams and Yu Sun
30  Enabling Safe and Reliable Surgeon-Robot Collaboration Niveditha Kalavakonda; Zeeshan Qazi; Laligam Sekhar; Ryan Calo; and Blake Hannaford
